channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Millions of American citizens abroad expected to answer ‘what’s going on’ under Trump 2.0 rule
item.description: People the world over talk about America—its policies, proclivities, its place in the world. They did it during the Iraq War and the first Trump admin...

item.title: Greenland PM accuses Washington of interfering in political affairs—says U.S. delegation’s ‘are not invited’
item.description: Greenland, which is seeking to become fully independent from Copenhagen, and Denmark itself have both repeatedly rebuffed Trump, insisting that only G...

item.title: Secret War Plans Shared in Group Chat, and U.S. Food Banks Scramble
item.description: Plus, why you might develop allergies as an adult.

item.title: A Hostage Released From Gaza Campaigns for the Release of Others
item.description: Trepidation over the fate of other captives has left Ilana Gritzewsky little time for self-healing after her own violent abduction.

item.title: Judge says Nazis detained in the U.S. during World World II got better legal treatment than Venezuelan immigrants who were deported to El Salvador
item.description: “We certainly dispute the Nazi analogy,” Justice Department attorney Drew Ensign responded during a hearing of the U.S. Court of Appeals for the Distr...

item.title: America’s Most Powerful Law Firms Won’t Stand Up to Trump
item.description: Bowing to Trump won’t protect their businesses and clients.

item.title: Canada’s Chrystia Freeland on preparing for the trade war with Trump
item.description: Also: White House leaks war plans on Signal, Samsung Co-CEO dies.

item.title: Hyundai announces $21 billion investment in the U.S. ahead of Trump’s sweeping tariff threat
item.description: It's the largest investment ever in the U.S. for the South Korean conglomerate according to its chairman Euisun Chung.

item.title: As Trump’s Policies Worry Scientists, France and Others Put Out a Welcome Mat

item.title: How a Cheap Drone Punctured Chernobyl’s Steel Shield During the Ukraine War
